algorithm_technique: Iterate through the flowerbed and greedily plant flowers.
problem_summary_simple: Check if 'n' new flowers can be planted in a flowerbed without adjacent flowers.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through the flowerbed, planting a flower whenever an empty plot has empty adjacent plots, decrementing 'n'.
key_insights: The greedy approach works because planting a flower in a valid spot never prevents more flowers from being planted later.
Edge cases (beginning and end of the flowerbed) need careful handling.
Modifying the flowerbed in-place simplifies the logic.
